intro: Tekel tricocca, commonly known as the three-lobed sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. Tekel tricocca is often found in wet or moist habitats such as marshes and stream banks.
